TextBody:
Hi Ramesh,

We took a look at what’s taking up the space and found out the following:


	There are over 30 million logs on the server, which is a really high number. These logs gathered from the last time you had disk space issues.
	Around 10 million of these logs are related to Unidentified file types


We would advise you to do the following:

	Run an Audit Log Backup to free up some extra space, if you wish, I can send you the steps.
	Go over the Content Aware Policies and only monitor what’s necessary.
	Limit, or stop monitoring Unidentified file types, since they take up around 33% of the logs.
	You can also create a File Location Allowlist if you want to skip monitoring a specific location.



We cleared some space from the Backups, but it will not last a long time, therefore, please run the Audit Log Backup as soon as possible.


Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

On Tue, Apr 22, 2025 at 1:44?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:



Hi Ramesh,

We took a look at what’s taking up the space and found out the following:


	There are over 30 million logs on the server, which is a really high number. These logs gathered from the last time you had disk space issues.
	Around 10 million of these logs are related to Unidentified file types


We would advise you to do the following:

	Run an Audit Log Backup to free up some extra space, if you wish, I can send you the steps.
	Go over the Content Aware Policies and only monitor what’s necessary.
	Limit, or stop monitoring Unidentified file types, since they take up around 33% of the logs.
	You can also create a File Location Allowlist if you want to skip monitoring a specific location.



We cleared some space from the Backups, but it will not last a long time, therefore, please run the Audit Log Backup as soon as possible.


Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

On Tue, Apr 22, 2025 at 1:44?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:



Hi Ramesh,

We took a look at what’s taking up the space and found out the following:


	There are over 30 million logs on the server, which is a really high number. These logs gathered from the last time you had disk space issues.
	Around 10 million of these logs are related to Unidentified file types


We would advise you to do the following:

	Run an Audit Log Backup to free up some extra space, if you wish, I can send you the steps.
	Go over the Content Aware Policies and only monitor what’s necessary.
	Limit, or stop monitoring Unidentified file types, since they take up around 33% of the logs.
	You can also create a File Location Allowlist if you want to skip monitoring a specific location.



We cleared some space from the Backups, but it will not last a long time, therefore, please run the Audit Log Backup as soon as possible.


Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
